bibl.title: Four Formerly Hesiodic Fragments.
bibl.note: Identifies fragments of the Odyssey, Demosthenes and Plutarch in papyri assigned on palaeographic grounds to rolls bearing securely identified Hesiodic fragments. - I. Hesiod fr. 90 (P. Oxy. XXVIII, 2495 [= M.-P.3 518.2; LDAB 1192], fr. 5) = Odyssey 16, 356-361. - II. Hesiod fr. 120 (P.S.I. XV, 1382 [= M.-P.3 516; LDAB 1227], fr. 2) = Demosthenes, Contra Eubulidem (57) 3. - III. Hesiod frr. 79 and 80 (P. Oxy XXVIII, 2481 [= M.-P.3 516.4; LDAB 1216], , frr. 6 and 7) = Plutarch, Quaest. Conviv. IV, 1, 2 and 3 (661C, 662A).
bibl.seg: David Danbeck, Four Formerly Hesiodic Fragments.

Identifies fragments of the Odyssey, Demosthenes and Plutarch in papyri assigned on palaeographic grounds to rolls bearing securely identified Hesiodic fragments. - I. Hesiod fr. 90 (P. Oxy. XXVIII, 2495 [= M.-P.3 518.2; LDAB 1192], fr. 5) = Odyssey 16, 356-361. - II. Hesiod fr. 120 (P.S.I. XV, 1382 [= M.-P.3 516; LDAB 1227], fr. 2) = Demosthenes, Contra Eubulidem (57) 3. - III. Hesiod frr. 79 and 80 (P. Oxy XXVIII, 2481 [= M.-P.3 516.4; LDAB 1216], , frr. 6 and 7) = Plutarch, Quaest. Conviv. IV, 1, 2 and 3 (661C, 662A).
